component.name: infinispan
component.title: Infinispan
component.description: Read and write from/to Infinispan distributed key/value store and data grid.
component.label: cache,clustering

hosts.description: Specifies the host of the cache on Infinispan instance

secure.label: common
secure.description: Define if we are connecting to a secured Infinispan instance

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

customListener.label: consumer
customListener.description: Returns the custom listener in use, if provided

eventTypes.label: consumer
eventTypes.description: Specifies the set of event types to register by the consumer.Multiple event can be separated by comma. The possible event types are: CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_CREATED, CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_MODIFIED, CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_REMOVED, CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_EXPIRED, CLIENT_CACHE_FAILOVER

defaultValue.label: producer
defaultValue.description: Set a specific default value for some producer operations

key.label: producer
key.description: Set a specific key for producer operations

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

oldValue.label: producer
oldValue.description: Set a specific old value for some producer operations

value.label: producer
value.description: Set a specific value for producer operations

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

cacheContainer.label: advanced
cacheContainer.description: Specifies the cache Container to connect

cacheContainerConfiguration.label: advanced
cacheContainerConfiguration.description: The CacheContainer configuration. Used if the cacheContainer is not defined.

configurationProperties.label: advanced
configurationProperties.description: Implementation specific properties for the CacheManager

configurationUri.label: advanced
configurationUri.description: An implementation specific URI for the CacheManager

flags.label: advanced
flags.description: A comma separated list of org.infinispan.client.hotrod.Flag to be applied by default on each cache invocation.

remappingFunction.label: advanced
remappingFunction.description: Set a specific remappingFunction to use in a compute operation.

resultHeader.label: advanced
resultHeader.description: Store the operation result in a header instead of the message body. By default, resultHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body, any existing content in the message body is discarded. If resultHeader is set, the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved. This value can be overridden by an in message header named: CamelInfinispanOperationResultHeader

password.label: common,security
password.description: Define the password to access the infinispan instance

saslMechanism.label: common,security
saslMechanism.description: Define the SASL Mechanism to access the infinispan instance

securityRealm.label: common,security
securityRealm.description: Define the security realm to access the infinispan instance

securityServerName.label: common,security
securityServerName.description: Define the security server name to access the infinispan instance

username.label: common,security
username.description: Define the username to access the infinispan instance

CamelInfinispanEventType.label: consumer
CamelInfinispanEventType.description: The type of the received event.

CamelInfinispanCacheName.description: The cache participating in the operation or event.

CamelInfinispanKey.description: The key to perform the operation to or the key generating the event.

CamelInfinispanValue.label: producer
CamelInfinispanValue.description: The value to use for the operation.

CamelInfinispanDefaultValue.label: producer
CamelInfinispanDefaultValue.description: The default value to use for a getOrDefault.

CamelInfinispanOldValue.label: producer
CamelInfinispanOldValue.description: The old value to use for a replace.

CamelInfinispanMap.label: producer
CamelInfinispanMap.description: A Map to use in case of CamelInfinispanOperationPutAll operation

CamelInfinispanOperationResult.label: producer
CamelInfinispanOperationResult.description: The name of the header whose value is the result

CamelInfinispanOperationResultHeader.label: producer
CamelInfinispanOperationResultHeader.description: Store the operation result in a header instead of the message body

CamelInfinispanLifespanTime.label: producer
CamelInfinispanLifespanTime.description: The Lifespan time of a value inside the cache. Negative values are interpreted as infinity.

CamelInfinispanTimeUnit.label: producer
CamelInfinispanTimeUnit.description: The Time Unit of an entry Lifespan Time.

CamelInfinispanMaxIdleTime.label: producer
CamelInfinispanMaxIdleTime.description: The maximum amount of time an entry is allowed to be idle for before it is considered as expired.

CamelInfinispanMaxIdleTimeUnit.label: producer
CamelInfinispanMaxIdleTimeUnit.description: The Time Unit of an entry Max Idle Time.

CamelInfinispanQueryBuilder.label: producer
CamelInfinispanQueryBuilder.description: The QueryBuilder to use for QUERY command, if not present the command defaults to InifinispanConfiguration's one

CamelInfinispanEntryVersion.label: consumer
CamelInfinispanEntryVersion.description: Provides access to the version of the created cache entry.

CamelInfinispanCommandRetried.label: consumer
CamelInfinispanCommandRetried.description: This will be true if the write command that caused this had to be retried again due to a topology change.

cacheName.description: The name of the cache to use. Use current to use the existing cache name from the currently configured cached manager. Or use default for the default cache manager name.

hosts.description: Specifies the host of the cache on Infinispan instance

secure.label: common
secure.description: Define if we are connecting to a secured Infinispan instance

customListener.label: consumer
customListener.description: Returns the custom listener in use, if provided

eventTypes.label: consumer
eventTypes.description: Specifies the set of event types to register by the consumer.Multiple event can be separated by comma. The possible event types are: CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_CREATED, CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_MODIFIED, CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_REMOVED, CLIENT_CACHE_ENTRY_EXPIRED, CLIENT_CACHE_FAILOVER

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

defaultValue.description: Set a specific default value for some producer operations

key.description: Set a specific key for producer operations

oldValue.description: Set a specific old value for some producer operations
